page.title: 04THE CHURCH COMMUNITY 2
page.content:
The Methodist Chapel in the High Street closed in the spring after the death of its staunchest supporter. There had been a very small attendance at the occasional afternoon service, conducted by a visiting Minister. As we write, the Chapel has been leased to a group of Pentecostals from the US Community. They are preparing to begin worship in Dec 86.
Links between the various churches on the Base and the Anglican Parish are strong. Our evening Organist also plays in the mornings for the Protestant Chapel on the base, and their choir sometimes sings in All Saints'. This summer the Protestant Chapels at Upper Heyford and Croughton gave their offering for July 21st as a gift to our Restoration Fund - a total of Â£764.76
